title.narrative: Lao PDR Upland Food Security Improvement Project

description.narrative: The Project Development Objective is to: (a) contribute to improved food security of rural households in selected poor villages in upland areas in the Project Provinces by demonstrating and implementing improved rice-based farming systems, and (b) address recovery needs of cyclone-affected households in the Xekong, Saravane and Attapeu provinces.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Section I. A. 4 (b) | Description :Recipient shall develop an Operation Manual for Components 1, 2 and 4 of theProject acceptable to IDA | Due Date :28-Feb-2011

Finance Agreement :Section I. A. 5 (a) | Description :Recipient shall adopt and disclose the Environmental and Social Screening andAssessment Framework of the Project, acceptable to the IDA. | Due Date :30-Sep-2010

Finance Agreement :Section I. A. 5 (b) (i) | Description :Recipient shall engage an international procurement consultant withappropriate experience and qualifications, and under terms of reference acceptable to IDA | Due Date :30-Sep-2010
Finance Agreement :Section I. A. 5 (b) (ii) | Description :Recipient shall assign a qualified national procurement consultant | DueDate :30-Sep-2010

Finance Agreement :Section I. A. 6 (a) | Description :Recipient shall appoint an international financial management consultant withappropriate experience and qualifications and under terms of reference acceptable to the Association. | Due Date :30-Nov-2010

Finance Agreement :Section I. A. 6 (b) | Description :Recipient shall appoint a national financial management consultant, withappropriate experience and qualifications and under terms of reference acceptable to the Association. | Due Date :30-Nov-2010

Finance Agreement :Section I. A. 6 (c) | Description :Recipient shall appoint and provide training to: (i) 2 additional financialstaff in Vientiane, and (ii) 2 additional FM staff in each conservation agriculture stations in the Project Provinces | Due Date:30-Nov-2010
Finance Agreement :Section I. A. 6 (d) | Description :Recipient shall appoint independent auditors acceptable to the Association |Due Date :30-Nov-2010

Finance Agreement :Section I. A. 6 (e) | Description :Recipient shall ensure that each of the Project Provinces, except Vientiane,adopts and implements an action plan, acceptable to the Association, to strengthen their FM capacity. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Section I. A. 6 (f) | Description :Recipient shall engage a FM information technology specialist or a localfirm, with appropriate experience and qualifications to modify MAFâ€™s accounting software package. | Due Date :30-Nov-2010

title.narrative: At least 2000 farmers reached by extension activities, of which 25% adopt improved techniques at project end
Collaborative research or extension sub-projects - under implementation
Rice production of participating farmers in seed producer groups increase by at least fifteen (15%) compared to baseline.
Area provided with irrigation and drainage services - Improved (ha)
Area provided with irrigation and drainage services - New (ha)
Area provided with irrigation and drainage services (ha)
Collaborative research or extension sub-projects - completed (number)
Number of villages benefiting from agriculture-related community sub-projects delivered through PRF participatory approaches.
Technologies demonstrated in the project areas (number)
Sample checks at village level confirm that inputs reach target beneficiaries.
MAF project management team operational and staffed with experienced fiduciary and technical specialists.
Increase in rice yields in beneficiary farmer groups by twenty percent (20%) compared to the baseline.
Production of incremental annual volume of quality seed (R1 and R2 seed) of at least 120 tons from centers supported under the project above the base line of 456 tons with the end target of 576 tons
